inference:
Solution:

The smaller hexagon is made up of 6 equilateral triangles.  Each of these triangles has side length equal to half the side length of the larger hexagon, so its area is $\frac{1}{4}$ the area of each triangle in the larger hexagon.  Since there are 6 triangles in each hexagon, the smaller hexagon has area $\frac{1}{4}$ the area of the larger hexagon.

Final Answer: $\boxed{\frac{1}{4}}$. I hope it is correct.
